intro: Calyptranthes venulosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which is typically thick and leathery, and its small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. Calyptranthes venulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
